intro: Silphium tetragonotheca, commonly known as the four-angled silphium, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its distinctive quadrangular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, which are typical of the daisy family. Silphium tetragonotheca thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its historical significance and ecological value, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
